snippet: Bold flavors harmonize in this coleslaw, and a food processor makes quick work of the fruit and vegetable components.

headline.main: Sweet and Pungent Apple and Cabbage Slaw

snippet: The new chief of Apple, Timothy D. Cook, received a one-time stock award worth nearly $400 million, the largest given by a company in a decade. The award was mean to signal the board's confidence in him as the successor to Steven P. Jobs.

headline.main: Apple's New Chief Gets Big Stock Award

snippet: Nokia on Monday introduced the Lumia 900, a smartphone that the Finnish cellphone maker and its software collaborator, Microsoft, hope will finally lead to redemption in the smartphone market.

headline.main: With Lumia 900, Nokia and Microsoft Bid for Smartphone Relevance

abstract: Timothy D Cook, the new chief of Apple, receives a one-time stock award worth more than $376 million, largest given by the company in a decade; award signals Apple's confidence in him as the successor to Steven P Jobs.

headline.main: Apple Makes Stock Award for New Chief
headline.print_headline: $376 Million Stock Grant For Apple Chief

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web each day for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes items on drones, data scientists, an Apple factory and a little bit of tech nostalgia.

snippet: At C.E.S., the world's biggest computer chip maker, Intel, made it clear it plans to pour a lot of money and effort into turning ultrabooks into the next big computing phenomenon.
